item.title: Wholesale prices rose 0.9% in July, much more than expected
item.description: The producer price index was expected to show a 0.2% increase for July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: Economist Sumerlin confirms he's in the running for Fed chair, backs big interest rate cut
item.description: Sumerlin said on CNBC that lowering the Fed's key rate would be an easy decision now.

item.title: As Trump berates Goldman, other economists agree that higher tariff inflation is coming
item.description: Goldman Sachs is taking the heat for its call that heavier tariff-induced consumer inflation is ahead, but it's far from alone in that view.

item.title: Goldman stands by call that consumers will bear the brunt of tariffs after Trump blasts bank's economist
item.description: Goldman Sachs economist David Mericle on Wednesday stood by a controversial forecast that tariffs will begin to hit consumer wallets.

item.title: Fed board contenders Miran, Bullard say Trump's tariffs are not causing inflation
item.description: Both did not commit to how they would vote on interest rates. However, they praised Trump's pro-growth agenda.
